Therefore, the code can be written as:

#include <stdio.h>

#define MOD 998244353

int main() {
    int A, B, C, D;
    scanf("%d %d %d %d", &A, &B, &C, &D);
    
    // First step: compute DP
    long long dp[3001][3001] = {0};
    dp[A][B] = 1;
    for (int c = A; c <= C; c++) {
        for (int d = B; d <= D; d++) {
            if (c == A && d == B) continue;
            long long ans = 0;
            if (c > A) {
                long long part = dp[c-1][d];
                ans = (part * d) % MOD;
            }
            if (d > B) {
                long long part = dp[c][d-1];
                ans = (ans + (part * c)) % MOD;
            }
            if (c > A && d > B) {
                ans = (ans - (dp[c-1][d-1] * (c-1) * (d-1))) % MOD;
            }
            dp[c][d] = (ans % MOD + MOD) % MOD;
        }
    }
    
    // Second step: count until 0. The input is the DP value.
    // The input is a single number, so the count is 1.
    int second_result = 1;
    
    // Third step: compute the third's result using second_result as input.
    long long position = second_result;
    long long nrstSeqStartIndx = 1;
    while (getValueAtIndex(nrstSeqStartIndx * 2) < position) {
        nrstSeqStartIndx *= 2;
    }
    while (getValueAtIndex(nrstSeqStartIndx + 1) <= position) {
        nrstSeqStartIndx++;
    }
    long long startIndex = getValueAtIndex(nrstSeqStartIndx);
    long long third_result = (position - startIndex) + 1;
    
    printf("%lld\n", third_result);
    return 0;
}

public static long getValueAtIndex(long index) {
    return 1 + ((index - 1) * index / 2);
}

So in C, that would be:

long long getValueAtIndex(long long index) {
    return 1 + ( (index -1) * index ) / 2;
}

But in C, functions must be declared before use. So I need to write that function. 

Also, in the code above, the third step's code must be implemented. 

So putting it all together:

#include <stdio.h>

#define MOD 998244353

long long getValueAtIndex(long long index) {
    return 1 + ( (index -1) * index ) / 2;
}

int main() {
    int A, B, C, D;
    scanf("%d %d %d %d", &A, &B, &C, &D);
    
    // First step: compute DP
    long long dp[3001][3001] = {0};
    dp[A][B] = 1;
    for (int c = A; c <= C; c++) {
        for (int d = B; d <= D; d++) {
            if (c == A && d == B) continue;
            long long ans = 0;
            if (c > A) {
                long long part = dp[c-1][d];
                ans = (part * d) % MOD;
            }
            if (d > B) {
                long long part = dp[c][d-1];
                ans = (ans + (part * c)) % MOD;
            }
            if (c > A && d > B) {
                ans = (ans - (dp[c-1][d-1] * (c-1) * (d-1))) % MOD;
            }
            // Ensure non-negative
            dp[c][d] = (ans % MOD + MOD) % MOD;
        }
    }
    
    // Second step: the input is the DP value (dp[C][D]). The second's output is 1.
    int second_result = 1;
    
    // Third step: compute using second_result as position
    long long position = second_result;
    long long nrstSeqStartIndx = 1;
    while (getValueAtIndex(nrstSeqStartIndx * 2) < position) {
        nrstSeqStartIndx *= 2;
    }
    while (getValueAtIndex(nrstSeqStartIndx + 1) <= position) {
        nrstSeqStartIndx++;
    }
    long long startIndex = getValueAtIndex(nrstSeqStartIndx);
    long long third_result = (position - startIndex) + 1;
    
    printf("%lld\n", third_result);
    return 0;
}
